But should they have done it? Abosolutely not. Although the CIA's policies and procedures for detainee treatment are as clear as mud, the Army's are not so. They are well written out. As a former JAG I personally assisted in giving Geneva Conventions and Law of War briefs to deploying Soldiers. They knew they were wrong. They just didn't have enough guts to tell someone they weren't going to obey and unlawful order. That makes them cowards, too.
